messages.content: What is ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting and who developed it?
ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting is a version of 'Visual Style Prompting with Swapping Self-Attention' developed by Naver AI.
Is ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting complete or still a work in progress?
As noted in the text, this is a work in progress (WIP).
Should I update my workflows and where can I find the updated workflow for ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting?
Yes, major changes have been made so it is advised to update your workflows. An updated workflow can be found in the `workflows` directory.
How do I use ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting with my models?
Clone the repository into your `custom_nodes` folder and place the node between your sampler and inputs as per the example image. This has currently been tested with 1.5 based models.
What are the input parameters for ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting?
How can I get the best results from ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting?

To get the best results, you must engineer both the positive and reference image prompts correctly. Focus on the details you want to derive from the image reference, and the details you wish to see in the output.
What is the result of using ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting?
Due to how this method works, you'll always get two outputs. To remove the reference latent from the output, you can use a Batch Index Select node.
How can I get the legacy functionality of ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting?
You can access the legacy functionality by pulling this [PR](https://github.com/ExponentialML/ComfyUI_VisualStylePrompting/tree/712a41579e730c5db87d68c2dcde4e92c48ab2cc).
